com.devpaul.bluetoothutillib

Class SimpleBluetooth

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.devpaul.bluetoothutillib.SimpleBluetooth

  • public class SimpleBluetooth
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Paul Tsouchlos Class for easily setting up bluetooth connections.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleBluetooth(android.content.Context context, android.app.Activity refActivity)
      Constructor for SimpleBluetooth Allows for easy handling for setting up connections and bluetooth servers to connect to.
      SimpleBluetooth(android.content.Context context, android.app.Activity refActivity, BluetoothHandler handler)
      Constructor for SimpleBluetooth Use this constructor to provide your own custom bluetooth handler.

      Connect to a generic bluetooth device.

      Connect to the bluetooth device knowing only the macAddress.
      void connectToBluetoothServer(java.lang.String macAddress)
      Connects to a bluetooth server set up on another device.
      void createBluetoothServerConnection()
      Creates a bluetooth server on this device that awaits for a client to connect.
      void endSimpleBluetooth()
      Ends all connections and unregister the receiver.

      Gets the used bluetooth utility.

      Method that must be called to set everything up for this service.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleBluetooth

        public SimpleBluetooth(android.content.Context context,
                       android.app.Activity refActivity)
        Constructor for SimpleBluetooth Allows for easy handling for setting up connections and bluetooth servers to connect to.
        Parameters:
        context - context from the calling activity
        refActivity - reference to the calling activity. Context and activity should match.

      • SimpleBluetooth

        public SimpleBluetooth(android.content.Context context,
                       android.app.Activity refActivity,
                       BluetoothHandler handler)
        Constructor for SimpleBluetooth Use this constructor to provide your own custom bluetooth handler.
        Parameters:
        context - the context of the calling activity.
        refActivity - reference to the calling activity. Context and activity should match.
        handler - custom BluetoothHandler for bluetooth event call backs.

    • Method Detail

      • setSimpleBluetoothListener

        public void setSimpleBluetoothListener(SimpleBluetoothListener simpleBluetoothListener)
        Sets a simple bluetooth listener for this service. Use this in your activity to get back the read data.
        Parameters:
        simpleBluetoothListener - the new simple bluetooth listener

      • setInputStreamType

        public void setInputStreamType(BluetoothUtility.InputStreamType type)
        Sets the input stream type for reading data from the bluetooth device.
        Parameters:
        type - the InputStreamType, can either be Normal or Buffered.

      • initializeSimpleBluetooth

        public boolean initializeSimpleBluetooth()
        Method that must be called to set everything up for this service.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(java.lang.String data)
        Sends data to the connected device.
        Parameters:
        data - The string of data to send.

      • sendData

        public void sendData(int data)
        Sends data to the connected device.
        Parameters:
        data - the int to send.

      • scan

        public void scan(int requestCode)
        Starts the device dialog to get a device to connect to.
        Parameters:
        requestCode - the request code for the intent. Use this to check against in OnActivityResult.

      • scan

        public void scan()
        Performs a scan of devices directly and does not launch the device dialog. If you want to receive found devices then you need to register the FoundDeviceReceiver in the activity and you also need the FoundDeviceReceiver.FoundDeviceReceiverCallBack.

      • cancelScan

        public void cancelScan()
        Cancels the ongoing scan started by scan()

      • connectToBluetoothDevice

        public void connectToBluetoothDevice(java.lang.String macAddress)
        Connect to the bluetooth device knowing only the macAddress.
        Parameters:
        macAddress - the mac address of the device. If this isn't valid, it won't connect.

      • connectToBluetoothDevice

        public void connectToBluetoothDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device)
        Connect to a generic bluetooth device.
        Parameters:
        device - Bluetooth device representing the device.

      • createBluetoothServerConnection

        public void createBluetoothServerConnection()
        Creates a bluetooth server on this device that awaits for a client to connect.

      • connectToBluetoothServer

        public void connectToBluetoothServer(java.lang.String macAddress)
        Connects to a bluetooth server set up on another device.
        Parameters:
        macAddress - the mac address of the server device. If this isn't valid, it won't connect.

      • connectToA2DPDevice

        public void connectToA2DPDevice(java.lang.String deviceName)
        Connects to an A2DP device.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the name of the device to connect to.

      • makeDiscoverable

        public void makeDiscoverable(int duration)
        Makes the device discoverable to other devices for a certain amount of time.
        Parameters:
        duration - the duration length in seconds.

      • endSimpleBluetooth

        public void endSimpleBluetooth()
        Ends all connections and unregister the receiver.

      • getBluetoothUtility

        public BluetoothUtility getBluetoothUtility()
        Gets the used bluetooth utility.
        Returns:
        the BluetoothUtility
